column1: - For some down-stream analyses on GWAS summary statistics, it is a problem for there to be SNPs with missing counts of observations (sample size). Some sets of GWAS summary statistics (such as 32769997_zhou_2020) originally had counts of observations for most but not all SNPs, and in these situations there are two reasonable solutions. First, it might be reasonable to fill those missing values with the maximal count of observations. Second, it might be reasonable to remove those few SNPs with missing counts of observations. The second option might be preferable over the first to avoid giving artificial maximal-sample-size weight to a few SNPs while many other SNPs have accurate counts of observations that are less-than-maximal.
